item.title: UVa OJ 1608 - Non-boring sequences
item.description: Problem A sequence is called non-boring if its every connected subsequence contains a unique element, i.e. an element such that no other element of that subsequence has the same value. Given a sequence of integers, decide whether it is non-boring. Input The first line of the input contains the number of test cases T. The descriptions of the test cases follow: Each test case starts with an integer n (1 ≤ n ≤ 200000) denoting the length of the sequence.
